sudoku.model

Class SudokuBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • sudoku.model.SudokuBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Board>, Board

    public class SudokuBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements Board
    A board consisting of intelligent SudokuFields being able to tell if it still is a valid Sudoku and offering ways to manipulate single cells through the interface Board.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private IntelligentSudokuCell[][] board 
      private int boxCols 
      private int boxRows 
      private int[] lastCellSet 
      private int numberOfFieldsPerStructure 
      static int UNSET_CELL
      Constant to indicate, that the content of a cell is not yet set.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SudokuBoard(int boxRows, int boxCols)
      Creates a new SudokuBoard that contains boxRows rows and boxCols columns resulting in boxRows * boxCols cells per row and per column.

        public SudokuBoard(int boxRows,
                   int boxCols)
        Creates a new SudokuBoard that contains boxRows rows and boxCols columns resulting in boxRows * boxCols cells per row and per column.
        Parameters:
        boxRows - The number of rows of the board.
        boxCols - The number of columns of the board.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public Board clone()
        Deep copies the board.
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Board
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The cloned board.

      • compareCellsByContent

        private static int compareCellsByContent(int content1,
                                         int content2)
        Compares two contents of cells according to ascending numbers. UNSET_CELL is treated to be larger than any other number.
        Parameters:
        content1 - The content of the first cell.
        content2 - The content of the second cell.
        Returns:
        -1 if content1 is smaller, 0 if equal, and 1 if bigger.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Board other)
        Compares two boards according to ascending numbers, which arise if the boards are red as number by concatenating all rows. An unset digit '.' is treated to be larger than the highest symbol.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Board>
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Board
        Parameters:
        other - The board to compare.
        Returns:
        -1 if this board is smaller, 0 if equal, and 1 if bigger.
        See Also:
        Comparable.compareTo(Object)

        Gets the number columns in a box.
        Specified by:
        getBoxColumns in interface Board
        Returns:
        The number of columns per box.

        Gets the number of rows in a box.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The number of rows per box.

      • getCell

        public int getCell(Structure struct,
                   int major,
                   int minor)
        Gets the content of a cell. For a non-empty cell the content will be returned, for an empty cell the constant Board.UNSET_CELL.
        Specified by:
        getCell in interface Board
        Parameters:
        struct - The coordinate type of the cell.
        major - The major coordinate component of the cell.
        minor - The minor coordinate component of the cell.
        Returns:
        The content of the cell or Board.UNSET_CELL.

      • getColumn

        private int getColumn(Structure struct,
                      int major,
                      int minor)
        Returns the position of the cell in the column depending on the given structure.
        Parameters:
        struct - The structure major and minor are given in.
        major - The number of the structure.
        minor - The position within the structure.
        Returns:
        The column of the position of the cell.

      • getLastCellSet

        public int[] getLastCellSet()
        Gets the coordinates of the last cell which was set.
        Specified by:
        getLastCellSet in interface Board
        Returns:
        The 2 dimensional coordinates of the last set cell as Structure.ROW {major, minor}, or null if no cell was set so far.

      • getNumbers

        public int getNumbers()
        Gets the number of cells in each structure. The result must be identical to the product of Board.getBoxRows() and Board.getBoxColumns(). This function is only for convenience.
        Specified by:
        getNumbers in interface Board
        Returns:
        The number of cells in each structure.

      • getPossibilities

        public int[] getPossibilities(Structure struct,
                              int major,
                              int minor)
        Gets all possible values of a cell, which can assigned to the cell without making the Sudoku invalid. If the cell is already set, null is returned. The returned array may be changed without having any effect on the board.
        Specified by:
        getPossibilities in interface Board
        Parameters:
        struct - The coordinate type of the cell.
        major - The major coordinate component of the cell.
        minor - The minor coordinate component of the cell.
        Returns:
        An array containing the left possible values for a cell, or null if the cell is already set.

      • getRow

        private int getRow(Structure struct,
                   int major,
                   int minor)
        Returns the position of the cell in the row depending on the given structure.
        Parameters:
        struct - The structure major and minor are given in.
        major - The number of the structure.
        minor - The position within the structure.
        Returns:
        The row of the position of the cell.

      • getStructureContainingCell

        private IntelligentSudokuCell[] getStructureContainingCell(Structure struct,
                                                           int row,
                                                           int col)
        Returns an Array containing all the cells of the given structure that contains the cell specified by row and col.
        Parameters:
        struct - The structure that should be returned.
        row - The row of a cell within the structure.
        col - The column of a cell within the structure.
        Returns:
        The structure containing the cell in (row, col).

      • isSolution

        public boolean isSolution()
        Checks if the board is a correctly solved Sudoku.
        Specified by:
        isSolution in interface Board
        Returns:
        true if the Sudoku is complete and correct, false otherwise.

      • isValidPosition

        private boolean isValidPosition(int pos1,
                                int pos2)
        Returns whether a position specified by major coordinate pos1 and minor coordinate pos2 is identifying a cell within the Sudoku or not.
        Parameters:
        pos1 - The major coordinate.
        pos2 - The minor coordinate.
        Returns:
        whether pos1 and pos2 specify the position of a cell or not.

      • prettyPrint

        public java.lang.String prettyPrint()
        Gets a string representation of the board layouted as rectangle.
        Specified by:
        prettyPrint in interface Board
        Returns:
        The rectangle string representation of the board.

      • removePossibility

        public void removePossibility(Structure struct,
                              int major,
                              int minor,
                              int number)
                       throws InvalidSudokuException
        Removes a certain number from the possibilities of a cell.
        Specified by:
        removePossibility in interface Board
        Parameters:
        struct - The coordinate type of the cell.
        major - The major coordinate component of the cell.
        minor - The minor coordinate component of the cell.
        number - The number to delete.
        Throws:
        InvalidSudokuException - If one tries to remove the only left possibility.

      • setCell

        public void setCell(Structure struct,
                    int major,
                    int minor,
                    int number)
             throws InvalidSudokuException
        Specifies the content of a cell. This is exactly possible one time, i.e., the content of a already set cell cannot be overridden.
        Specified by:
        setCell in interface Board
        Parameters:
        struct - The coordinate type of the cell.
        major - The major coordinate component of the cell.
        minor - The minor coordinate component of the cell.
        number - The number to which the cell is fixed.
        Throws:
        InvalidSudokuException - if the Sudoku changed to unsolvable by setting the number.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gets a single line string representation of board. The rows of the board are appended by using one space separation.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Board
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The string representation.
